DataElement.preferredName: First Chemotherapy Post Randomization Administered Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date on which an observation was made or an event occurred related to the administration of first time of chemotherapy occurring after the allocation of individuals to groups by chance.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of first time of chemotherapy occurring after the allocation of individuals to groups by chance.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04)

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:The allocation of individuals to groups, e.g., for experimental and control regimens, by chance. (On-line Medical Dictionary):Given.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
